text: Vladimir Grigoryevich Kulakov (, born April 23, 1944 in Komsomolsk-on-Amur, Khabarovsk Krai, Russian SFSR) was the 3rd Governor of Voronezh Oblast in Russia from 2000 to 2009. He sees himself in favour of strengthening of intelligence agencies. He became governor on December 24, 2000 and was re- elected on March 14, 2004. On February 16, 2009 his term ending on March 12 was not prolonged by Dmitry Medvedev. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:People from Komsomolsk-on-Amur Category:KGB officers Category:Governors of Voronezh Oblast
title: Vladimir Kulakov
